cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.SD, cs.IT, cs.NI

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of identifying the source of a rumor spreading in a network, using the susceptible-infected (SI) model. This falls under the broad category of network science and analysis, which is covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. The most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which specifically deals with the study of social and information networks, their properties, and their impact on society. Other likely sub-categories include cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.SD (Software Engineering), cs.IT (Information Theory), and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), as the paper involves the use of mathematical models, statistical inference, and optimization techniques to analyze the behavior of the rumor spreading process in a network.
